qas.question: What other activities does the UNFCCC require the IPCC to run?

answers.text: the Data Distribution Centre and the National Greenhouse Gas Inventories Programme

qas.question: What councils assign tasks to the IPCC?

answers.text: WMO Executive Council and UNEP Governing Council
WMO Executive Council and UNEP Governing Council

qas.question: Which organization does the UNFCCC processes support?
What is one of the minor functions of the IPCC?
Who is responsible for running the National Greenhouse Gas Inventories Programme?
What measures the levels of fuel consumption?

context: The IPCC concentrates its activities on the tasks allotted to it by the relevant WMO Executive Council and UNEP Governing Council resolutions and decisions as well as on actions in support of the UNFCCC process. While the preparation of the assessment reports is a major IPCC function, it also supports other activities, such as the Data Distribution Centre and the National Greenhouse Gas Inventories Programme, required under the UNFCCC. This involves publishing default emission factors, which are factors used to derive emissions estimates based on the levels of fuel consumption, industrial production and so on.
